question: Sarah has 15 stickers. She gives 6 stickers to her brother and 4 stickers to her friend. How many stickers does Sarah have left?
A bookshelf has 3 shelves. Each shelf has 8 books. If 5 books are taken away, how many books are left on the bookshelf?
Tom is thinking of a number. When he adds 12 to his number, he gets 25. What number is Tom thinking of?
In a parking lot, there are 7 cars and some motorcycles. If there are 18 vehicles in total, how many motorcycles are there?
Emma saves $3 every day for a whole week. On Sunday, she spends $8 on a toy. How much money does she have left?
A train has 4 carriages. Each carriage has 12 seats. If 15 seats are empty, how many passengers are on the train?
Look at this number sequence: 2, 5, 8, 11, ___. What number comes next?
A garden has roses and tulips. There are 16 flowers in total. If there are 9 roses, how many tulips are there?
Jake has 24 marbles. He wants to put them into bags with 6 marbles in each bag. How many bags will he need?
A rectangle has a length of 9cm and width of 4cm. What is the perimeter of this rectangle?
If today is Tuesday, what day will it be in 10 days?
Amy has 3 boxes of crayons. Each box has 8 crayons. She loses 7 crayons. How many crayons does she have now?
Which number is 5 more than the sum of 14 and 8?
A clock shows 3:15. How many minutes past 3 o'clock is this?
Ben has 45 cents. He buys a pencil for 18 cents and an eraser for 12 cents. How much money does he have left?
A triangle, a square, and a circle are arranged in a pattern: △□○△□○. What shape comes next?
There are 28 children in a class. 13 are boys. How many more girls than boys are there?
A farmer has 36 eggs. He puts them into cartons of 6 eggs each. How many full cartons can he make?
What is the smallest number that you can make using the digits 5, 2, and 8?
Lisa reads 4 pages of her book every day. After 5 days, she has read 32 pages in total. How many pages had she already read before these 5 days?
A number pattern goes: 50, 45, 40, 35, ___. What is the next number?
In a race, Alex finished 3rd, Ben finished 7th, and Carl finished between them. What position could Carl have finished?
A pizza is cut into 8 equal slices. Tom eats 3 slices and Jerry eats 2 slices. What fraction of the pizza is left?
Maya has some stickers. She gives away 8 stickers and has 17 left. How many stickers did she start with?
A school bus stops 6 times on its route. At each stop, 4 children get on the bus. How many children are on the bus after all stops?
Which fraction is equivalent to 6/8?
A box contains 15 red balls, 12 blue balls, and 8 green balls. How many balls are in the box altogether?
If 1 dozen equals 12, how many items are in 3 dozen?
A rectangle is divided into 4 equal parts. If 3 parts are shaded, what fraction is NOT shaded?
Sam counts by 7s: 7, 14, 21, 28, ___. What number comes next?
A store has 48 apples. They are packed into bags of 8 apples each. How many bags are needed?
What is the difference between the largest and smallest two-digit numbers?
A cube has 6 faces. Each face has 4 corners. How many corners does a cube have in total?
Tim has 63 stickers. He arranges them in rows of 9 stickers each. How many complete rows can he make?
A digital clock shows 08:45. How many minutes until 9:00?
In a bag, there are 4 red marbles, 6 blue marbles, and 5 yellow marbles. What is the total number of marbles?
A pattern shows: 1, 4, 7, 10, 13, ___. What is the rule for this pattern?
Rosa has 2 twenty-dollar bills, 3 ten-dollar bills, and 4 five-dollar bills. How much money does she have?
A shape has 5 sides and 5 corners. What is this shape called?
If you arrange 20 chairs in 4 equal rows, how many chairs will be in each row?
What is 3/4 of 20?
A tree grows 3 centimeters each month. How tall will it be after 6 months if it starts at 45 centimeters?
Which number comes next in this sequence: 64, 56, 48, 40, ___?
A library has 3 floors. The first floor has 25 books, the second floor has 18 books, and the third floor has 32 books. How many books are there in total?
If 1 week = 7 days, how many days are in 5 weeks?
A hexagon has how many sides?
Danny has 84 baseball cards. He wants to put them in albums with 12 cards per page. How many pages will he need?
What is the sum of all the odd numbers from 1 to 9?
A rectangle has an area of 24 square units. If its width is 4 units, what is its length?
In a month with 31 days, if the 1st is a Monday, what day of the week is the 31st?
A shopkeeper has 72 oranges. He sells them in bags of 8 oranges each. After selling all the bags, how much money does he make if each bag costs $5?
Lucy collects stamps. She has 5 pages with 7 stamps on each page. If she gives away 12 stamps, how many stamps does she have left?
A number is 6 more than 27. What is half of this number?
In a classroom, there are 6 rows of desks with 5 desks in each row. If 8 desks are empty, how many students are present?
A baker makes 48 cupcakes. He puts them in boxes of 6 cupcakes each. How many boxes does he fill?
What is the next number in this pattern: 3, 7, 11, 15, ___?
Mike has 2 bags of marbles. One bag has 16 marbles and the other has 19 marbles. He loses 7 marbles. How many marbles does he have now?
A square playground has sides of 12 meters each. What is the perimeter of the playground?
If it takes 15 minutes to walk to school, and school starts at 8:30, what time should you leave home?
A pattern goes: ★○★★○★★★○___. What comes next?
Jenny has 64 stickers. She wants to share them equally among 8 friends. How many stickers will each friend get?
What is the largest number you can make using the digits 4, 1, and 9?
A train journey takes 2 hours and 45 minutes. If the train leaves at 10:15, what time does it arrive?
In a bag of 30 candies, 12 are red, 8 are blue, and the rest are green. How many green candies are there?
A book has 96 pages. Tom reads 8 pages each day. How many days will it take him to finish the book?
Which fraction is larger: 2/3 or 3/4?
A parking meter costs 25 cents for 30 minutes. How much does it cost for 2 hours?
In a zoo, there are 15 birds, 8 mammals, and 12 reptiles. How many animals are there in total?
A rectangle is 8cm long and 3cm wide. What is its area?
What comes next: 81, 72, 63, 54, ___?
Sarah has 3 coins: 2 quarters and 1 dime. How much money does she have?
A triangle has sides of 5cm, 7cm, and 8cm. What is the perimeter?
If you save $4 every week, how much will you have after 9 weeks?
A pentagon has 5 sides. How many sides do 3 pentagons have altogether?
What is 1/2 of 38?
A movie starts at 2:15 PM and lasts for 1 hour and 30 minutes. What time does it end?
In a class survey, 14 students like pizza, 9 like burgers, and 5 like both. How many students were surveyed?
A ladder has 12 steps. Tom climbs up 8 steps, then down 3 steps. Which step is he on now?
What is the sum of the first 5 even numbers? (2, 4, 6, 8, 10)
A cylindrical can has a circular base and curved sides. How many flat surfaces does it have?
Anna buys 3 notebooks for $2 each and 2 pens for $1 each. How much does she spend in total?
A clock shows 6:20. How many minutes until half past 6?
In a number sequence: 4, 9, 14, 19, ___. What number comes next?
A box contains 42 chocolates arranged in 6 equal rows. How many chocolates are in each row?
What is the difference between 73 and 28?
If today is Friday, what day was it 4 days ago?
A garden has 18 roses arranged in 3 equal rows. If 2 roses from each row are picked, how many roses are left?
Which number is exactly halfway between 16 and 28?
A pizza has 12 slices. If 3/4 of the pizza is eaten, how many slices are left?
What is 5 × 9?
A school has 8 classes with 24 students in each class. How many students are there in the school?
Complete the pattern: 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, ___
A rectangle is twice as long as it is wide. If the width is 6cm, what is the perimeter?
In a race, Lisa finished 2 positions ahead of Mark. If Mark finished 7th, what position did Lisa finish?
A farmer has 56 chickens. He puts them in coops with 8 chickens in each coop. How many coops does he need?
What is 2/5 of 25?
A number multiplied by 6 gives 54. What is the number?
If 1 meter = 100 centimeters, how many centimeters are in 2.5 meters?
A calendar shows that March has 31 days. If March 1st is a Wednesday, what day is March 31st?
In a bag of mixed nuts, there are 16 almonds, 12 walnuts, and 8 cashews. What fraction of the nuts are almonds?
A cube has 8 corners and 12 edges. How many faces does it have?
